div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 322px; height: 1px; padding-top: 0px; margin-left: 15px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left; max-height: 200px; overflow: hidden;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.div: 1. User to have a folder and files placed on it are synced to all devices owned by the user
2. User can upload manually as well
3. User can rename/edit/delete file and the changes are reflected on all devices used by user

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 392px; height: 1px; padding-top: 200px; margin-left: 15px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left; max-height: 130px; overflow: hidden;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.div: 4. Information reflected across different clients should be as consistent as possible

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 422px; height: 1px; padding-top: 380px; margin-left: 15px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left; max-height: 220px; overflow: hidden;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.div: 3. Avg file size of a user --> 10MB
5. Avg user may have 3 devices minimum --> phone, tablet, laptop

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 152px; margin-left: 625px;

div.div: UserId| Name| Size consumed| Machines associated with user
FileID| UserID| path of the file
2. Files can reside on the disk
3. API to upload file on the server
4. API to read file from the server
5. API to update meta data on server
6. A client to check if the files have been modified or not
7. client to sync files back to user's machine

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 462px; height: 1px; padding-top: 160px; margin-left: 465px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left; max-height: 223px; overflow: hidden;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.div: upload(user_id, file_id, path on S3, block)
writeToLocal(user_id, machine_id, local path on disk, path on S3, block)
updateMeta(user_id, file_id, ModificationList) #imagine modification list as a json
checkForModification(user_id,file_id, modification timestamp (in UTC) on local)
--> return file chunks modified, new modification timestamp

div.div: 1. checks if the file is modified
5. Checks if the chunk is modified make update call to the server
File ID| File Mata Data Path name, modified timestamp
7. If time stamp is diff from last --> find hashes again

div.div: if user belongs to a specific zone, keep data in data centers associated with the user
If user is a frequent traveler, may be in multiple zone

3. More number of files per user --> keep in a wide column store like cassandra

Synchronize Time
Ensures Client's time is always in UTC when user sends data

div.h1: How to ensure security aspect of files?
div.div: 1. Meta Data of file can have info of who is owner, who has read access, who has write access etc

switch.text: How to ensure security aspect of files?...

div.div: Uses round robin/random or load based balancing

display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

span.font: The quickest method is direct transfer from computer to computer, over a LAN, but this is not always possible.
Delta Sync --> Transfer only modified section of the file

div.style: box-sizing: border-box ; position: relative ; line-height: 1.8125rem ; color: rgb(41 , 47 , 50) ; font-family: "brandon_txt_reg" ; background-color: rgb(255 , 255 , 255)

a.title: Overview - Dropbox
a.style: box-sizing: border-box ; color: rgb(35 , 45 , 56) ; border-bottom: 2px solid rgb(207 , 217 , 227)

font.span: - As the name suggests, LAN Sync looks through a local area network for the key information prior to checking in cloud storage. LAN Sync only checks computers on the same local area network, which saves time if computers sharing a common router have also shared files.

div.style: box-sizing: border-box ; position: relative ; line-height: 1.8125rem ; color: rgb(41 , 47 , 50) ; font-family: "brandon_txt_reg" ; background-color: rgb(255 , 255 , 255)
box-sizing: border-box ; position: relative ; line-height: 1.8125rem ; color: rgb(41 , 47 , 50) ; font-family: "brandon_txt_reg" ; background-color: rgb(255 , 255 , 255)

a.title: Overview - Dropbox
a.style: box-sizing: border-box ; color: rgb(35 , 45 , 56) ; border-bottom: 2px solid rgb(207 , 217 , 227)

font.span: - Streaming Sync is said to greatly decrease latency by beginning the download to a second device before the upload from the original device is complete.

a.text: Viewer does not support full SVG 1.1
